diseases.description: Caused by Cercospora zeae-maydis fungus. Creates rectangular gray-brown lesions with yellow halos on leaves. Thrives in warm, humid conditions and can significantly reduce yield.
symptoms: Lesions may merge causing leaf blight
solutions: Apply fungicides containing strobilurins or triazoles
Rotate crops to break disease cycle
Monitor weather conditions for early intervention
prevention: Maintain proper plant spacing for air circulation

diseases.description: Caused by Puccinia sorghi fungus. Produces small, oval, cinnamon-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces. Most common in cool, humid weather conditions.
symptoms: Small oval rust-colored pustules on leaves
Pustules on both upper and lower leaf surfaces
solutions: Apply fungicides if economic threshold is reached
Monitor fields regularly during cool, humid periods
prevention: Avoid planting in low-lying, humid areas
Monitor weather forecasts for favorable disease conditions

diseases.description: Caused by Exserohilum turcicum fungus. Creates large, elliptical, gray-green lesions on leaves. Favored by moderate temperatures and high humidity.
solutions: Apply fungicides preventively in high-risk areas
Implement crop rotation with non-host crops

diseases.description: Healthy corn plants show vibrant green leaves without disease symptoms. Proper nutrition and growing conditions support optimal plant health.
solutions: Monitor regularly for early disease detection

diseases.description: Caused by Alternaria solani fungus. Creates dark brown spots with concentric rings on leaves. Thrives in warm, humid conditions and can affect tubers.
symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings
Tuber lesions with dark, sunken areas
solutions: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper
Ensure proper plant spacing for air circulation
Harvest tubers when mature and dry

diseases.description: Caused by Phytophthora infestans. Most destructive potato disease. Creates water-soaked lesions that turn brown. Spreads rapidly in cool, humid conditions.
symptoms: Brown to black lesions with yellow margins
White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
solutions: Harvest before disease spreads to tubers

diseases.description: Healthy potato plants display vigorous growth with dark green foliage. Proper cultural practices maintain plant health and maximize yield potential.
Caused by Xanthomonas species bacteria. Creates small, dark spots on leaves, stems, and fruit. Spreads through water splash and contaminated tools.
symptoms: Small, dark brown to black spots on leaves
Fruit spots are raised and scab-like

diseases.description: Caused by Alternaria solani fungus. Creates dark spots with concentric rings on lower leaves first. Common in warm, humid conditions.
symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings
Target-like lesions starting on lower leaves
solutions: Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash

diseases.description: Caused by Phytophthora infestans. Devastating disease that can destroy entire crops quickly. Favored by cool, wet conditions.
symptoms: Brown to black lesions with yellow margins
White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides
Fruit rot with firm, brown lesions

diseases.description: Caused by Passalora fulva fungus. Primarily affects greenhouse tomatoes. Creates yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with fuzzy growth underneath.
symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces
Olive-green to brown fuzzy growth on undersides
Spots may merge causing leaf yellowing

diseases.description: Caused by Septoria lycopersici fungus. Creates small, circular spots with gray centers and dark borders. Starts on lower leaves and moves upward.
symptoms: Small circular spots with gray centers
Tiny black specks in spot centers

diseases.description: Caused by Tetranychus urticae. Tiny arachnids that feed on plant sap. Create stippling damage and fine webbing. Thrive in hot, dry conditions.
symptoms: Fine stippling or speckling on leaves
Fine webbing on leaves and stems
solutions: Use predatory mites as biological control
Spray with water to dislodge mites

diseases.description: Caused by Corynespora cassiicola fungus. Creates circular spots with concentric rings resembling targets. Affects leaves, stems, and fruit.
symptoms: Brown to gray centers with dark borders
Spots on leaves, stems, and fruit

diseases.description: Viral disease causing mosaic patterns on leaves. Transmitted through infected seeds, tools, and handling. No cure available once infected.
symptoms: Mosaic pattern of light and dark green on leaves

diseases.description: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies. Causes severe leaf curling and yellowing. Can devastate tomato crops in warm climates.
Healthy tomato plants exhibit vigorous growth with dark green foliage and normal fruit development. Proper care maintains optimal plant health.
